newsitem.title: USA: PremiumWear says will not sell business.
newsitem.headline: PremiumWear says will not sell business.

text.p: PremiumWear Inc said Friday it is no longer attempting to sell its Premium/Special Markets business and will instead operate the business.

"In light of the growth of the Premium/Special Markets business the board feels the best way to improve shareholder value is through the continued operation of the company's business, which we intend to pursue vigorously," said Thomas Gleason, Chairman and Chief Executive of PremiumWear.

As previously reported, the company sold its trademarks to Supreme International Corp. Proceeds will be used in part to fund the Premium/Special Markets business, which it said grew from nearly $16 million in sales in 1995 to an estimated $28 million in 1996.
As part of the sale to Supreme, PremiumWear changed its name from Munsingwear Inc. PremiumWear markets Munsingwear-brand knit shirts and other apparel items under license from Supreme.
